title: Create a user with role for OO Workflow Designer
content:
This topic describes the steps required to create a user with appropriate permission.

Create a user with a predefined role

This topic describes the steps to create a new user with a predefined role.

Create a user

To create a user, perform the following steps:

  1. From the IdM Administration console home, select OO organization.
  2. Click Users >  .
  3. Enter the following details: Name, Display Name. and Password.
  4. Click Save. A new user gets added to the list.

Edit an existing group

To edit an existing group:

  1. Choose a group, then click   on the top right menu to edit an existing group.
  2. Click the Associated Roles drop-down and select any of the existing roles. For example, Administrator.
  3. Under the Users area, click the Associated Users drop-down and select the newly created user.
  4. Click SAVE. The new user gets created with a predefined Administrator role.

Create a user with a custom role

Create a user

To create a user, perform the following steps:

  1. From the IdM Administration console home, select OO organization.
  2. Click Users >  .
  3. Enter the following details: Name, Display Name. and Password.
  4. Click Save. A new user gets added to the list.

Create a new role

  1. Go to OO Workflow Designer Application > IdM Administration Console > Roles. The page displays the list of roles available in OO Workflow Designer.
  2. Click   on the top right menu to add a new role and fill the following fields: Name and Display Name.
  3. Click Associated Permissions drop-down list box and select one or more appropriate permission/s from the available options. For example, flowDebug.
  4. Click SAVE. A new role gets created with permissions.

Create a new group

To create a user group, perform the following steps:

  1. From the IdM Administration console home, select OO organization.
  2. Click Groups >  to create a new group.
  3. From the GROUP SETTINGS page, enter the following details: Name and Display Name.
  4. Click the Associated Roles drop-down and select the newly created role.
  5. Under the Users area, click the Associated Users drop-down and select the newly created user.
  6. Click SAVE. The new user gets created with a custom role.
